name: botrytis
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a fungus (= an organism that get its food from decaying material or other living things) that grows on the fruits and flowers of plants: The most common form of botrytis is grey mould, which can affect many plants and fruits. Botrytis is of particular concern to winemakers, who need to protect their vines from this damaging fungus, although there is also "good" botrytis which can help to make sweet wines.
More examplesFewer examplesBotrytis has destroyed almost all my tulips.At this nursery, they dip the roses in fungicide to prevent botrytis.One of the great sweet wines of the world, there are clear hints of botrytis and honey on the nose.
